title: How is multilingualism important in education? In which way? - Quora

response.answer_text: In my experience, multilingualism dramatically expands one’s education. It means first of all that one can travel to a variety of countries with differing languages and appreciate their culture, their museums and the people far more richly than if one were dependent on one’s mother tongue. In addition, multilingualism allows one to learn and appropriate knowledge that would have been inaccessible before. Finally, multilingualism allows one a certain freedom from the misconceptions, stereotypes and commonly held views of one’s own country so that one can literally see the world through new eyes. Unfortunately, multilingualism has decline farther and farther in the American system of education—both in public education and in higher education.

In CA, the majority of students at my high school were Hispanic. I didn’t speak much Spanish, so I would ask other students to translate for me. I was told that if they weren't English speakers, they weren’t supposed to bein my English classes. It would have been very helpful if I had at least spoken Spanish.
